pr_title: CLDR-14163 Add missing character to parseLenients

timeline.bodyText: Adding OL CHIKI PHAARKAA is very strange; it is a modifier letter, not a math symbol, general symbol or punctuation. We don't want to add arbitrary confusables. I think the change should be in ICU.
timeline.author: macchiati
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -67,13 +67,13 @@ for derived annotations.
 			<parseLenient sample="₹">[₨₹{Rp}{Rs}]</parseLenient>
 		</parseLenients>
 		<parseLenients scope="number" level="lenient">
-			<parseLenient sample="-">[\-‐‒–⁻₋−➖﹣－]</parseLenient>
-			<parseLenient sample=",">[,،٫、︐︑﹐﹑，､]</parseLenient>
+			<parseLenient sample="-">[\-ᱼ‐‒–⁻₋−➖﹣－]</parseLenient>

replies.bodyText:
It is used in locale "sat" as the minus sign, which is why I added it here.  parseLenients covers all minus signs in all locales.  (If that should no longer be the case, and ICU change will be required)

  
    
      cldr/common/main/sat.xml
    
    
         Line 667
      in
      1d75dd4
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <minusSign>ᱼ</minusSign>
replies.author: sffc

replies.bodyText: Up to this point, parseLenients has been a strict superset of the corresponding symbols in locale data.  If you want to break that invariant, it might be a remarkable change to the way ICU's number parser works.
replies.author: sffc

timeline.bodyText:
See comment below.
U+1C79 | OL CHIKI GAAHLAA TTUDDAAG is a modifier letter. Suggest removing from ICU's test.
timeline.author: macchiati
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -56,7 +56,7 @@ for derived annotations.
 			<parseLenient sample=":">[\:∶︓﹕：]</parseLenient>
 		</parseLenients>
 		<parseLenients scope="general" level="lenient">
-			<parseLenient sample=".">[.․。︒﹒．｡]</parseLenient>
+			<parseLenient sample=".">[.ᱹ․。︒﹒．｡]</parseLenient>

replies.bodyText: Similarly, this character is used as the decimal separator in locale "sat".
replies.author: sffc

timeline.bodyText: This REVERSED COMMA looks ok (unlikely to ever happen) but it is a punctuation character at least.
timeline.author: macchiati
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -67,13 +67,13 @@ for derived annotations.
 			<parseLenient sample="₹">[₨₹{Rp}{Rs}]</parseLenient>
 		</parseLenients>
 		<parseLenients scope="number" level="lenient">
-			<parseLenient sample="-">[\-‐‒–⁻₋−➖﹣－]</parseLenient>
-			<parseLenient sample=",">[,،٫、︐︑﹐﹑，､]</parseLenient>
+			<parseLenient sample="-">[\-ᱼ‐‒–⁻₋−➖﹣－]</parseLenient>
+			<parseLenient sample=",">[,،٫⹁、︐︑﹐﹑，､]</parseLenient>
 			<parseLenient sample="+">[+⁺₊➕﬩﹢＋]</parseLenient>
 		</parseLenients>
 		<parseLenients scope="number" level="stricter">
-			<parseLenient sample=",">[,٫︐﹐，]</parseLenient>
-			<parseLenient sample=".">[.․﹒．｡]</parseLenient>
+			<parseLenient sample=",">[,٫⹁︐﹐，]</parseLenient>

replies.bodyText:
So we could take this but not the others, and make 2 changes in ICU.
Or just make 3 changes in ICU.
replies.author: macchiati

replies.bodyText: I don't understand what you mean by "just make 3 changes in ICU".  The failing ICU test is a data-driven test that ensures that parseLenients is a superset of the number formatting symbols in all locales.
replies.author: sffc

timeline.message:
CLDR-14163 Add missing character to parseLenients; fix sat symbols

See #694

CLDR-14163 Add missing character to parseLenients; fix sat symbols

See #694
